skill.name: auth-analyzer
skill.description: Review and analyze authentication and authorization patterns for security vulnerabilities.
skill.summary: Review and analyze authentication and authorization patterns for security vulnerabilities.
skill.author: CuriousLearner

security_audit.summary: Pure prompt-based skill containing only educational security content and code examples. No executable code, network calls, filesystem access, or external command execution. This is a legitimate security analysis tool for AI assistants.

content.value_statement: Authentication and authorization vulnerabilities create serious security risks in applications. This skill provides expert analysis of code patterns to identify and fix security flaws before they can be exploited.
actual_capabilities: Review password hashing implementations for security weaknesses
Analyze JWT token generation and verification patterns
Check authorization controls for access control vulnerabilities
Identify authentication bypass and privilege escalation risks
Verify compliance with OWASP Top 10 and NIST guidelines
limitations: Does not execute or test actual code files
Cannot access external systems or APIs
Provides analysis based on patterns shown in code examples only
Does not perform live penetration testing

use_cases.title: Code security review
use_cases.description: Review authentication code for vulnerabilities during security assessments and audits

use_cases.title: Secure coding guidance
use_cases.description: Learn best practices for implementing secure authentication and authorization in your applications

use_cases.title: Compliance checking
use_cases.description: Verify that authentication implementations meet security and compliance requirements

prompt_templates.title: Basic analysis
prompt_templates.prompt: Use the auth-analyzer skill to review this authentication code for security vulnerabilities and provide remediation advice

prompt_templates.title: JWT review
prompt_templates.prompt: @auth-analyzer Analyze this JWT implementation for security issues including signature verification, token expiration, and algorithm vulnerabilities

prompt_templates.title: Authorization audit
prompt_templates.prompt: @auth-analyzer Review this authorization system for broken access control, privilege escalation, and IDOR vulnerabilities

prompt_templates.title: Full security report
prompt_templates.prompt: @auth-analyzer --report Analyze all authentication and authorization patterns in this code and generate a comprehensive security report with severity ratings

output_examples.input: Use auth-analyzer to review our login implementation for security issues
output: Password Storage: Uses bcrypt with cost factor of 12 - GOOD
Session Management: Cookie lacks secure flag - MEDIUM RISK
Rate Limiting: Not implemented - HIGH RISK for brute force attacks
Recommendations: Add rate limiting, enable secure cookie flag, consider MFA

best_practices: Always verify JWT signatures and specify allowed algorithms to prevent algorithm confusion attacks
Regenerate sessions after successful authentication to prevent session fixation
Implement proper authorization checks on every endpoint that accesses protected resources
anti_patterns: Storing passwords with MD5 or SHA1 without salt - enables rainbow table attacks
Verifying JWT tokens by decoding without signature validation
Trusting client-provided role values for authorization decisions

faq.question: Which AI tools support this skill?
faq.answer: The auth-analyzer skill works with Claude, Codex, and Claude Code. Simply prefix your prompt with @auth-analyzer to activate the security expertise.

faq.question: What authentication patterns does it analyze?
faq.answer: It reviews password hashing, JWT tokens, session management, OAuth flows, RBAC, ABAC, and checks for OWASP Top 10 compliance issues.

faq.question: Does this skill modify my code?
faq.answer: No. The skill only analyzes code patterns and provides recommendations. It never writes or modifies any files or code in your project.

faq.question: Is my code data sent to external services?
faq.answer: No. All analysis happens within your AI session. Code examples are processed locally and never transmitted to external servers.

faq.question: Why are authentication vulnerabilities reported?
faq.answer: Broken access control and authentication failures are the top OWASP security risks. This skill helps identify these issues before deployment.

faq.question: How does this compare to manual code review?
faq.answer: This skill provides consistent analysis based on established security patterns. It complements but does not replace thorough manual security review.
